text:
ARD,Autosomal dominant intermediate Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type B
What is (are) Wyburn Mason's syndrome ?,"Wyburn Mason's syndrome is a condition in which blood vessels do not form correctly in both the retina of one eye and a part of the brain.  These malformed blood vessels are called arteriovenous malformations (AVM).  Wyburn Mason's syndrome is present from birth (congenital) and the cause is unknown.  Individuals with this condition may have additional AVMs in other parts of the body,
